intro: Anacamptis morio nothosubsp. romerae, commonly known as the Romerae Orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and coloration. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation terms.
